original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up in mid-morning trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were up during mid-morning trade on Thursday, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 30.00/30 percent on Thursday, up from 29.95/30.00 percent on Wednesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 26.30/27.00 percent, up from 26.10/25 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 27.00/75 percent, down from 27.20/28.20percent.

State debt office said, 70,000 million Treasury Bonds under the series of 22.00 percent 2024’A’ and 110,000 million Treasury Bonds under the series of 18.00 percent 2027 ‘A’ are to be issued through an auction on March 13, 2023. (Colombo/Mar 09/2023)
